results.title: Wedding in Galilee = Noce en Galilee [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Marisa Films, LPA, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen and Michel Khleifi
results.brief_description: Abu Adel, the Mukhtar of a Palestinian village is given permission to hold a traditional wedding for his son on the condition that the Israeli military governor and his staff be guests of honor at the ceremony. Agreeing to the governor’s condition immediately created division and anger amongst his family, and the village community, resulting in a conspiracy by some of the younger men to sabotage the wedding and kill the governor and his soldiers. Conflict between families, the underlying tension between the Israelis and the wedding guests, failure of the groom to consummate his marriage, and the hatred which the groom has for his father, are just some of the many threads which weave this intriguing story together to provide an insight into the culture, contradictions and hostilities which exist in occupied Palestine. “Wedding in Galilee” was the first feature film made in Palestine by a Palestinian director, Michel Khleifi (Forbidden marriages in the Holy Land, 1995), who believes that “culture is meant to be controversial”. This international multi-award winning film is controversial in more ways than one with its blend of politics and culture, and sensuality and sexuality. Although a slow-moving, lyrical film, there is however, an underlying intensity, an expectation that disaster is imminent. Sadly and quite ironically, the Intifada began only six months after the film was shot. Cast includes Makram Khouri, Youssef Abou Wardeh, Jouliano Mer Khamis, Buchra Karaman, Anna Achdian, Nazih Akleh, Sonia Amar. (Awards: Cannes; San Sebastian; Belgium; Tunisia) In Arabic and Hebrew with English subtitles.

results.title: Wedding at York
results.brief_description: The wedding of HRH the Duke of Kent and Miss Katherine Worsley at York Minster. As the bride leavers her home, members of the Royal Family assemble at the great cathedral. The arrival of Her Majesty the Queen with Prince Philip and Prince Charles is followed by the ceremony at which Dr Ramsey, then Archbishop of York, officiated. The wedding over, the bride and her husband leave the cathedral to the cheers of waiting crowds.

results.title: Wedding
results.brief_description:
An interactive CD-ROM produced as part of Victorian College of the Arts Interactive Media degree. ‘Wedding’ allows an interactive exploration of different characters at a wedding. A wide range of permuations are generated as the user selects characters to interact with each other; triggering recorded conversations and short movie pieces.

“Wedding explores behaviours and expectations that seem to be exclusively associated with weddings. Not only from the bride, but from her friends and family as well - it seemed that weddings stil retain much of their symbolic power in people’s imagination. ‘Wedding’ uses interactivity to give the user the chance to explore a non-linear situationwith characters that they choose and identify with or are interested in”.

results.title: Webwurld
results.credit_line:
Jess Johnson and Simon Ward

Single-channel video work

ACMI Collection
results.material_description: Soundtrack by Andrew Clarke. video, colour and audio
results.brief_description: Webwurld appears like fragments of a dream, mesmerising its viewers with a cosmic, otherworldly dimension that seems to stretch out in every direction.

constellations_primary.name: Webwurlds
constellations_primary.description: Jess Johnson and Simon Ward's work is inspired by science fiction and fantasy. Johnson's hand-drawn illustrations are heavily detailed with geometric patterns and incorporate anthropomorphic characters amongst architectural environments in immersive other worlds.

constellations_other.name: Speculative futures, sci-fi worlds and environmental disaster
constellations_other.description: Deborah Kelly's The Gods of Tiny Things explores extinction and the climate crisis, the scars of colonialism, and the political shift to the right around the world through collage and imagined futures, much like these sci-fi, animated and computer-generated artworks.

constellations_other.name: From queer period romances to surrealistic worlds
constellations_other.description: Explore the interconnections between queer period dramas, through to sci-fi and surrealistic worlds.

results.description:
Webwurld appears like fragments of a dream, mesmerising its viewers with a cosmic, otherworldly dimension that seems to stretch out in every direction. Working from Jess Johnson’s complex hand-drawn images, video artist Simon Ward rebirths her 2D images as chimerical 3D animations.

“My drawings are meshworks of cultural symbology, humanoid clones, messianic figures and alien runes placed in architectural settings. This practice feeds into installations and collaborations in animation, music, fashion, virtual reality and textile art. These additional mediums bring the world of my drawings into physical and virtual spaces, providing an immersive experience for audiences.” – Jess Johnson
description_for_label:

These additional mediums bring the world of my drawings into physical and virtual spaces, providing an immersive experience for audiences.” – Jess Johnson

results.title: Weaving linen
results.brief_description: A general account of modern factory methods of weaving linen. The following processes are illustrated: preparing the weft yarn for the shuttle; preparing the warp; threading the heddles; weaving the linen; and the finish processes including pre-shrinking, scalding, bleaching and dyeing, calendering and folding. An animated diagram is used to explain how the loom works.
results.description: A general account of modern factory methods of weaving linen. An animated diagram is used to explain how the loom works.

results.title: Weaving
results.creator_credit: International Film Foundation and Hermann Schlenker
results.brief_description: Illustrates how weaving is a practical craft, vital to the survival of the Pushtu tribe. Shows how the Pushtu women work on old, crude portable wooden looms. This program has no dialogue but a soundtrack.

results.title: Weave me a rainbow
results.creator_credit: Templar Film Studios, Films of Scotland and Edward McConnell
results.brief_description: Wool is born, not made. The dyeing and weaving of wool in Scotland, in colors and textures inspired by Scotland’s own landscape, and the production of fine woollen cloth form the main theme of the film.

results.title: Weatherwise
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, John Martin-Jones and Bern Gandy
results.brief_description: The weather affects man in every phase of his living. To learn what the weather will be, weather reports from all over the continent are sent to the Weather Bureau where they are plotted on to maps. From these a daily weather forecast is made.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, John Martin-Jones and Bern Gandy

results.title: Weathering & soils
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 15 of Series “Earth revealed”.
Weathering of the earth’s surface is important to geologists as they examine the impact of this process. There are two types: mechanical and chemical weathering. Mechanical weathering involves the disintegration and break-up of fragments of rock at the earth’s surface naturally. The composition of the rock doesn’t change at all. In chemical weathering, water and air decompose the rock and change its composition such as iron ore can become oxidised into rust in the presence of water. Acid raid formation is affected by the chemical weathering of the earth’s surface as is soil composition and productivity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
